image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: ACT Policing has issued a warning to the community after two people died yesterday from suspected drug overdoses.

title.children: Public health warning issued after two people die from suspected drug overdoses in Canberra

image.altText: A building with mult-coloured exterior.

props.synopsis: Canberra man Aleu Mapiou pleads not guilty by reason of mental impairment to the murder of fellow mental health unit patient Dusko Culibrk at the Canberra Hospital in November 2022.

title.children: 'We are completely destroyed': Mother of man killed in mental health unit speaks of grief during court hearing

image.altText: Stephen Mitchell sits at a cafe holding a take-away coffee cup.

props.synopsis: Convicted paedophile and former national rock climbing coach Stephen Mitchell loses a bid to have his child sexual abuse sentence reduced due to a judge's calculation mistake, and is sentenced to an additional 19 months for lying to get a top secret security clearance.

title.children: Stephen Mitchell, who abused six girls he coached in rock climbing, sentenced to an extra 19 months' jail

image.altText: A young girl shoots a basketball on an indoor court

props.synopsis: After-school activities can offer physical and mental health benefits, improved resilience and better academic performance, but how can families balance these with the time and financial costs?

title.children: Extracurricular activities provide big benefits to kids – but how much is too much?

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: The court heard the 28-year-old travelled straight from a jail in Sydney to assault his ex-partner, in breach of a family violence order.

title.children: Released Long Bay jail inmate who travelled to Canberra to rape ex partner given 10-year sentence

image.altText: A schoolboy and an elderly lady smile at the camera side by side.

props.synopsis: Much like ABC TV's award-winning series 'Old People's Home for Teenagers', a weekly initiative at Club Kalina in Canberra is offering students the opportunity to develop social bonds while contributing in a meaningful way to their local community — and it's been a resounding success.

title.children: How school kid Mason became friends with Helen, who lives with dementia

image.altText: A woman with shoulder length blonde hair in an orange sweater holds a mug that reads "straight outta Tuggers".

props.synopsis: Growth in Canberra has shifted to the north and west in recent years, and the Tuggeranong area is not predicted to expand. So what can residents who've already made this southern suburb their home expect?

title.children: This area is set to have zero per cent population growth. What does that mean for its residents?

image.altText: Fears Tasmania left exposed after AFP officers removed from Hobart's airport

props.synopsis: AFP officers have walked off the job at seven major airports around the country as part of ongoing industrial action.

title.children: AFP officers walked off the job from seven major airports, but didn't make their action public due to security concerns

image.altText: An older man wearing hi-vis coat smiles, photographed from the side, against a grey sky

props.synopsis: Scientists are concerned that a toxic herbicide widely used in Australian farming could be linked to the growing prevalence of Parkinson's disease. It sat on the regulator's shelf for review for decades, while the company manufacturing it hid a mounting body of evidence that its product was harmful.

title.children: Australian farmers are 'rolling the dice' on a toxic herbicide with a concerning link to Parkinson's disease

image.altText: Trump Cheng collage

props.synopsis: The Hong Kong billionaires who saved Donald Trump from bankruptcy have finally achieved what he could not: a piece of the Australian casino business.

title.children: 'Dangerous' Australian casino connections saved Donald Trump from ruin

image.altText: wintery day in tasmania as snow and dark clouds mover across a mountain

props.synopsis: The extreme weather variability observed across Australia in late August will become even more pronounced through the first days of spring.

title.children: Spring snow heading to south-east Australia as record run of winter heat comes to an end

image.altText: Ryley Batt of Australia in action, chasing the ball in his wheelchair

props.synopsis: Following a loss on day one to Great Britain, Australia's wheelchair rugby team have bounced back to defeat the home nation in Paris. Follow live.

title.children: Steelers keep medal dream alive with thrilling two-point win over France

image.altText: A composite image featuring photos of Peter Dutton, Anthony Albanese and Adam Bandt.

props.synopsis: The Greens and the Coalition seemingly have the government stuck in a game of piggy in the middle, desperately trying to catch the ball as it is thrown between its two major political opponents.

title.children: Albanese is stuck in a game of piggy in the middle, desperately trying to catch the ball

image.altText: LGBT flag

props.synopsis: The government's pair of about-faces on the census has left residual frustration in its ranks.

title.children: Inside Labor's census wobble: How the government made an issue by trying to unmake it

image.altText: Missy Higgins

props.synopsis: After two decades in the music industry, singer-songwriter Missy Higgins says she's never felt more vulnerable.

title.children: Missy Higgins on the moment her life 'burned to the ground'

image.altText: A blind woman sitting on the arm of a couch looking out the window.

props.synopsis: People with disability have long felt discriminated against when travelling by air. After the release of the long-awaited Aviation White Paper, could things be about to change?

title.children: When Emma's at the airport, she often feels 'like a piece of luggage' instead of a human being

image.altText: NSW MP Rory Amon from the liberal party stands behind a lectern talking while inside nsw parliament house

props.synopsis: NSW MP for Pittwater Rory Amon quit parliament after he was arrested and charged with child-sex offences on Friday. His resignation means the NSW Liberal Party will now face by-elections in Pittwater, Epping and Hornsby.

title.children: NSW Liberal Party facing three by-elections after MP's resignation

image.altText: A group of young Palestinian men stand in a street next to the burnt-out wreckage of a car.

props.synopsis: Hostilities have escalated in the West Bank while fighting between the IDF and Hamas still rages in the Gaza Strip, nearly 11 months after Israel invaded the territory.

title.children: Israeli police kill top Hamas commander near Jenin as West Bank assault enters third day

image.altText: Elon Musk

props.synopsis: Elon Musk-owned social media platform X is ordered to suspend its operations in Brazil amid an ongoing feud between the country's supreme court and the media magnate.

title.children: Brazil orders immediate shutdown of Elon Musk's X

image.altText: A police car blocks off the entrance to a government facility

props.synopsis: An Indigenous teenager who died after self-harming at Banksia Hill had only been in the facility for two days, according to authorities. Here's what else we know about the latest tragedy in WA youth detention.

title.children: What we know so far about the death of another teenager inside WA's troubled youth justice system

image.altText: A woman with dark hair smiles with a man behind her

props.synopsis: The stakes for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz were high as they sat down with CNN for their first interview since Joe Biden stepped aside. These were the biggest moments.

title.children: It's no secret Kamala Harris hates interviews. These were the big moments from her sit-down with CNN

image.altText: A man in a suit smiles at the camera, while standing next to a vacant block of land.

props.synopsis: Götene has a population problem, and in a bid to attract new residents, it's almost giving away blocks of land. The "wild plan" has gone viral online, and the town mayor hopes it could put the forgotten town back on the map.

title.children: Inside this forgotten Scandi town's 'wild plan' to sell land for the price of a coffee

image.altText: The cuple in white and pick in a portrait embrace

props.synopsis: Learn all of the controversies surrounding the newest Norwegian royal couple, before they tie the knot this today.

title.children: All the controversies behind a norwegian princess' wedding to a celebrity shaman explained

image.altText: Andrew Irvine speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Could Australia's big banks offer very long-term, fixed-rate mortgages — in the ballpark of 20 to 30 years? That question was raised in a House of Representatives standing committee this week.

title.children: NAB CEO questioned about potential of very long-term, fixed-rate home loans filling gap in affordable mortgage market

image.altText: Two fighter jets flying together.

props.synopsis: The commander of Ukraine's air force is dismissed as an investigation seeks to establish whether the death of pilot Oleksii "Moonfish" Mes in an F-16 fighter jet crash this week was due to Ukraine's own air defence system.

title.children: Zelenskyy fires Ukrainian air force commander after F-16 fighter pilot killed repelling Russian missiles

image.altText: the outside of a building

props.synopsis: Once perceived as the glittering symbol of city sophistication, Australia's biggest listed casino group has found itself reduced to the status of last chance saloon.

title.children: Fallen Star: Why Australia's gaming giant is hanging by a thread

image.altText: seven-network-journalist-robert-ovadia delivers the news as he looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Robert Ovadia have argued that the behaviour, which included sending a photo of a flaccid penis from the internet, was not sexual harassment and that his dismissal was unlawful.

title.children: Sacked Seven journalist dismisses complaints, denies behaviour was sexual harassment

image.altText: A phone inside a mug that says 'have a nice day'.

props.synopsis: On December 12, 2022, three innocent people were ambushed by extremists and murdered in cold blood in a country Queensland town. Why it occurred may never be fully understood.

title.children: It started as a routine police call. By the end of the night, six people were dead

image.altText: Three children playing on a beach with storm clouds in the distance.

props.synopsis: The death toll from recent monsoon rain also rose, with children among the dead after a house was destroyed in a mudslide in rural Pakistan.

title.children: Warnings of rare August cyclone in Pakistan and India lead thousands to evacuate

image.altText: A man in glasses, China's ambassador to the Pacific nations Qian Bo, wearing a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: China's ambassador to the Pacific says the situation "must be corrected" after the region's leaders reject a push from Solomon Islands to stop Taiwan participating in its top diplomatic gathering.

title.children: 'Must be a mistake': China responds furiously after Pacific leaders reject bid to cut ties with Taiwan

image.altText: AFL umpire in high vis t-shirt on an AFL ground.

props.synopsis: The AFL has slapped a life ban on a 23-year-old Carlton fan, after he allegedly threw a water bottle that struck and injured a goal umpire.

title.children: AFL bans footy fan for life for throwing water bottle at a goal umpire

image.altText: Tom Trobjecvic walks off bleeding holding his elbow

props.synopsis: Manly puts on an attacking clinic to tear apart the NRL's best defence in the Bulldogs to keep their chances of a home final alive, before Penrith get back to winning ways to wrap up a top four spot.

title.children: Injuries sour impressive Manly victory over Bulldogs in front of record crowd

image.altText: Damaged ship with mast down at port with a shipping container in the background

props.synopsis: Two people are injured following a collision between a large container ship and a training vessel at a Perth port.

title.children: Two people injured as container ship collides with training vessel at Perth port

image.altText: Opera Australia artistic director Jo Davies sits in an audience seat in an empty theatre.

props.synopsis: Jo Davies, artistic director of Opera Australia, has left the company over a 'difference in opinion' with the CEO and board about how to balance artistic and commercial imperatives.

title.children: 'I am incredibly sad': Opera Australia's first woman artistic director leaves role after nine months

image.altText: A woman with short black hair wearing a black and white shirt looks seriously at the camera. She is inside.

props.synopsis: Pressure is building for the board members of Australia's largest Indigenous legal aid service to step down, after revelations the federal and NT attorney-general departments have lost confidence in their ability to manage the organisation.

title.children: NAAJA co-founder calls for entire board's resignation amid internal turmoil
